review_detailed_main: Tall girl is a movie about a tall girl. Thats the movie, and don't you dare forget it. My favorite part was when the protagonist, Jodi, was tall.

review_title: I liked it and then I didn't and then I liked it and then I didn't
review_detailed_main: I mean, it wasn't bad... but I feel like they didn't quite catch Jodi's personality. It was mostly people telling us how amazing she is, but all we see is her being down or whinging about something. I would have liked to see the more caring and "fun" side. It was stated that she was "fun" a few times, but where was that?? It was very choppy in a few bits. Like there were scenes missing that could have added to the experience. There was one part, though, that made me a bit mad, and that was the caesarean part. I haven't had one myself, but that was incredibly offensive to millions of women. It's as though they were made to feel ugly for bringing life into this world and something that usually comes from an emergency. Not cool guys. The rest of the movie was average. In saying that, it was a nice, easy watch when you want to just turn off the brain and watch a Netflix teen romcom.

I'm not going to rant on about the plot because you can Google it but I will say that this is an adorable movie that for once didn't have the clearest ending. For once the main characters weren't 30 year olds playing 17 year olds and I think it was, overall, pretty realistic. The characters were pretty good and, as a short girl, I couldn't always relate to Jodi but the movie is about so much more than just height.
As a 6'2'' female this is highly unrealistic. People are not this shallow. This movie made it seem that being tall was a disease. Ridiculous.

Yes it was a Dumplin for Tall Girls. Which I loved Dumplin!!!! If you havent seen it go and watch it NOW!! Its a typical teen movie like in the 80s teen movies. But I liked this story too. We always see the chubby girl we never see a tall girl. Unless shes playing for the basketball team etc.... It was a cute movie. I loved Angela Kinseys role! Its so different from her office role lol. And Jodys sister that actually sticks up for her sister is great!

Next time Netflix desides to make a movie with an exchange student - try casting one that actually speaks the language! The swedish was awful, the accent was horrible! It sounded like a mixture between made up german and russian combined. There is a distinct swedish accent, the actor just didn't have the decency to learn it. And sidenote, Sweden is the second best English speaking country for it not being the first language in the world, so a big part of the swedish population doesn't even have an accent. And also - no person in that young age would be named Stig or Ingvar. Those would be the names of 80 years old men. Is it to much to ask for Netflix to get an accent and a name correct? Instead they are lett with a really unbelievable story. Gör om gör rätt.
When a young gay falls in love with whole passions and all what he's cares about is you are happy and enjoy

review_title: File Under: Movies Written to Fulfil a Fantasy

review_detailed_main:
Pun aside, this is a very straightforward teen comedy. Ugly or in that case tall duckling included. It's still pretty neat and it may surprise you once or twice even if it is quite predictable overall. It is well played by the actors who have to fight through the obvious and try to maintain a mystery and suspense, even if we as viewers know better.

So overall decent, but more aimed at a certain audience who will leap this up and take it all in with gusto.

review_title: So far fetched and stupid story
review_detailed_main: She's not even that tall. I'm a 6'3" female and I was never a social outcast. I always had a ton of friends and had a fantastic high school experience. My height helped me get recognized in sports. Getting a full volleyball scholarship to a Div.1 school. I've had modeling gigs and I love standing out in a crowd. This show shames tall girls like we're supposed to be embarrassed about it. This is a lame story.

This wasn't an award winning movie but it was cute ~ a little unrealistic in the fact that they made her out to be freakishly tall but she's not. I can't say anything terrible about it and it's one you can watch w your tweens. I enjoyed it!

review_title: As a fellow tall girl, I enjoyed this cute movie
review_detailed_main: As woman who is 6'1.5" (don't forget the half!) and always the tallest girl in school, I can completely relate to the struggles Jodi faces in this movie. The dumb jokey "Green Giant" "do you play basketball" comments always got on my nerves and I always felt out of place just like she did. I had a short boyfriend in HS and everyone teased us and made comments, but it just shows how superficial people can be. I finally found my peace with my height and wouldn't want to be any other way! This is a fun movie with a good message and not here to solve world hunger, so just enjoy it for what it is. I do think they purposely casted very short people in this movie to make her look even taller. My fave line was the very last and what I choose to do - stand tall!

review_title: The exchange student "Stig" was in no way Swedish
review_detailed_main: Started watching this movie and it was watchable up until the point the "Swedish" exchange student began to speak English with a forced accent that didn't even sound remotely like a Swede speaking English and then his "Swedish" was clearly an American that had learnt a few lines of Swedish... Why couldn't Netflix actually get an authentic Swedish actor for this role? Immediately after this the credibility of the movie was shot and we stopped watching .. it was too painful to listen to.

Severely underwhelming coming of age film with some really strange choices at times re: parental shame, Cesareans, and stalking friendzoned chumps that can't take a hint.

Choppy edits, poor takes on the "mean girl" trope and no developed relationships between anyone. Surface level and cringe.

Swedish accent was also atrocious.

Little redeeming quality apart from picture and audio quality, which is a given from Netflix.

review_title: Surprisingly good for what it is
review_detailed_main:
Before my actual review, I dont actually understand all the negativty around this movie. Yes there are some querks and yes the film plot is very unrealistic framing swedes as a pretty silly stereotype. Being a swede myself I can easily see through how the movie producers really did not care for researching how to make a character and actor appear swedish - i mean even non swedish speaker must admit that his accent sounds more german than any nordic language.

Anyway, all these issues aside, I genuinly enjoyed the movie. Being of a genre thats supposed to be a bit silly and shamy, you have to be the right type of person to understand it and i think im one of those. Dont take it too seriously and give it a shot.

review_title: Terrible with wrong messages being sent
review_detailed_main: Within the first 5 minutes, you could tell the movie was clearly terrible and not something I would want myself or my family to watch. What sent me over the edge was when they said a crude remark regarding caesarean c-sections, and "if she really wants to go through the rest of her life with a big, old scar on that beautiful torso...". I just had an emergency c-section and it's hard enough physically and mentally, society doesn't need a movie drawing out the negativites with the surgery because in reality, my child is here and healthy and that's all that matters, not some" big, old scar". However this day in society we tend to care too much about what is on the outside, and this movie encourages that.
I decided to write a review because of all the awful reviews this film has received. It's a watchable film and not half as bad as the reviews it has gotten. Jeez! It's cute and worth watching!
Just another coming of age movie. Although there are plot points to wince over, I for the most part enjoyed it, and thought Ava Michelle did a good job in her first leading role.

The movie is of the opinion that even though the main character is a very attractive girl, since she is tall, she is therefore ugly. Yeah... That makes zero sense!

This movie is littered with embarrassing high school movie clichés!
The bully is a bully because she's insecure
Token black girl best friend combined with the quirky best friend cliché
Makeover
Clichéd insults like, "How's the weather up there?"
Handsome foreign-exchange student


There are stupid set ups with equally stupid payoffs. Like the box the main male carries around. I mean, seriously?

And what is up with the cinematography of this movie? It doesn't fit at all! It's like the director saw Mr. Robot and thought to themselves, "Ooo, yeah, I want to do that!"

review_title: From a tall girl's point of view

review_detailed_main: Previous reviewers seem lost in the minutiae of this movie. I enjoyed it thoroughly!

review_title: Awful lol Save yourself and dont watch this
review_detailed_main: Some people are trying so hard to be oppressed. Such a corny movie. Like somebody had a terrible idea for an afterschool special and turned it into full length movie with cheesy dialogue, horrible acting, and just bad directing. It was raining all day on my day off so I stayed in and watched netflix. Should have just went and sat in the rain instead of putting myself through this.

Everyone in this movie is terrible. They are all terrible people. The only genuine one is the beauty queen sister. This movie does send all the wrong messages to the audiences its aimed at and seriously homegirl is just tall...shes rich or at least not poor,pretty, blonde and tall.
In a world full of bullying this movie shows the reality of high school life for some. A view point from several angles !! Our house enjoyed it !!

review_title: So sick of "swedish" in english speaking movies
review_detailed_main:
I'd say it's sometimes trying too hard, and I think that it's time for mean girl in movies to change. The movie as a whole was ok and entertaining enough to have in the background while foulding laundry. So I guess that counts for something.

This poor swedish guy Stig Mohlin - btw, Stig and Ingvar are not that common names among teens - who speaks swenglish in a way that sounds like no accent I've ever heard before, more like maaany accents combined. Pleeeeease don't go there if you can't pull it off. This might be whiny, but I am done with the swedish accents in movies. Sincerely, tired and (maybe?) offended swede. 😂

review_title: Not the best but good message
review_detailed_main:
I just got done watching this movie and I thoroughly enjoyed it. It's a super sweet movie about a tall girl, Jodi, finding herself and being comfortable about who she is.

I would recommend this movie, because sometimes you just need to be reminded that it's ok to be who you are, no matter the cards you've been dealt, you can work with it and you're still perfect and amazing.

review_title: As a tall girl myself, I can't believe this is a real thing
review_detailed_main:
So I'm 5'10". Three inches shorter than our protagonist, but still, I think I qualify as a tall girl.

This movie was both stupid, AND inaccurate.

On one level, it claims that being a tall girl is one of the worst things on the planet. Let's start by clarifying one thing: tall girls are NOT a marginalized group. To claim so is ridiculous and offensive to marginalized people who actually face discrimination. Aside from that absolute clownery, the plot was predictable, cheesy, and just stupid.

On top of that, it didn't even get the actual experience of being a tall female right. The one thing they focused on was the "boy problem", which isn't even the worst of it. There was a whole shopping/makeover sequence and there wasn't a single joke about jeans turning into capris when you put them on, or putting on a shirt and having to accept it as a crop top. There wasn't anything about looking for shoes by size first, and then deciding if you like the style. The Tall Girl never once had to cram into the small backseat of a car and deal with the lack of leg room, and never was she asked to grab the cereal off the top shelf. Even with the absolute idiocy of claiming tall girls are discriminated against, it didn't even serve as an accurate representation of being one.

The best thing about this movie is the absolute hilarious criticism it has spawned on Twitter and YouTube, and I'd highly encourage you to seek that instead of watching this dumpster fire.

review_title: If you like the title you will like the movie
review_detailed_main: A typical high school movie with a lot of cliches where the main character is an eccentric girl who has self-confidence issues because of her heights. The movie labeled a comedy but there aren't any jokes - or there are but those aren't that kind of jokes that make you laugh. Basically, the title of the movie says the whole story, it's so simple. But for those people who are into tall women like I am, I can tell, this is a really good love story. I was so excited the whole time about what will be the outcome of the story between the short guy and the tall girl. This isn't a groundbreaking movie, but it goes against "the man has to be taller than a woman" tradition and I love the movie for this.

This is a show for 11-16 year olds. With THAT in mind, it was a cute show with an important message. Almost everyone thinks they're a reject in one way or another when we're kids. This show just offered another angle in which to see ourselves.

I was in my class at the end of the school year and a girl asked the teacher for permission to put "Tall Girl". At first I thought I was going to get bored and it was literally like that for more than 3 classes we were looking at this stupidity that makes no sense. It is literally what you saw in those Disney Channel movies, the plot is of a girl who suffers bullying because only that is high. It makes me angry to think that jokes are not funny. The whole movie gives special cringe the "Motivational Message" it gives and I say it in quotes because it is not motivational. If you want to waste your time do whatever is less watch this movie.

review_title: Blue and yellow, blue and yellow.
review_detailed_main:
This director really loves to put blue and yellow in every single scene. Unclear why, is it suppose to make us think of Sweden? Or perhaps they live in a parallel universe where the color combination is super duper popular. In either case stop it, it's super annoying.

Also the Swede does not speak Swedish so well. Maybe he just forgot how to?
Second half of the movie was great!!! The story is great.. first half was so-so.. but in the end I loved it so much :)

The problem here is it's not funny so it's not a comedy and it's too unrealistic to be a drama. The characters are mostly irritating and hard to sympathise with. Jody is so bland I could not care less about where she ends up at the end.

PS the musical "number" in the first half of the movie was so cringey I could barely watch it! Stay away from this piece of trash
Why is this good? I'm afraid I don't have the energy to answer. There's a lot of reasons and I normaly is really hard on movies.

I watched approximately seven minutes of this movie and I can surely say it is already making me quite upset. Her father in his first scene of the film proceeds to attempt to take away his daughter's ability to have children someday because of the social pressures which make his "unnaturally" tall daughter not normal. He attempts to get her potentially harmful drugs which could affect her later in life and seemingly continues to prod her for her entire young life about what disease she "must" have in order to be so tall and freakish. It is so upsetting to watch a film with such terrible writing and even worse that it continues to isolate those who are on the taller spectrum of height. As a person with a female best friend who is 6'2", I find this to be a terrible movie plot and I hope Netflix can get its act together and put out more uplifting and inclusive products.

I appreciated that this movie focused on the bullying and insecurities that can come with your height. Tall girls can readily be found on volleyball and basketball teams (and others), but not every tall girl wants to play sports. It's not the same for tall guys. Especially when you are particularly introverted, the last thing you want is to be a head or more taller than everyone else. The writing was funny at times and cringe-worthy at others (such is the style of teen movies). I enjoyed it overall. It was a clean movie with a good message about being proud of who you are despite what people say. Flaws? Yes, but what movie is perfect?

review_title: So confusing. She's not even that tall.
review_detailed_main: The movie made no sense and didn't seem remotely realistic. Why was everyone so short? Started watching it not having the best gauge of the imperial system so was like, "alright, 6 foot 1 must be tall. After googling it, it's only ~ 185cm. I at 16 I was probably about 178cm with a 11/12 men's shoe and that is pretty average. Why is everyone at this school so damn short? Make her least 2m tall if you want it to be remotely dramatic.
I was surprised to see the low rating. The main character was well played, her family funny and relatable. Go watch it, and ignore the ratings.

The Key point of this review: It gave me an amazing feeling of seeing a TALL GIRL in the lead role! Being a tall Girl myself, it is a nice feeling to see an actress on tv and be able to relate to that person!

unfortunately the movie had a lot of clichés which ended up overlooking some of the important dilemmas that you meet out there. No reason to make a movie with so many stereotypes. No need to make you feel bad for the main character, next time just make a movie with a tall or a short or a skinny or a fat or a normal Girl as the lead role, and make her confident from the beginning.

review_title: A "white minority" film at its best.

review_detailed_main: People who are slagging this off seem to forget that this is aimed towards kids/young adults. My kids enjoyed it.

I watched this movie on Netflix hoping for something fresh and new and what I got was the complete opposite. The script and story is basically just an "updated" version of John Hughes's Pretty In Pink with a few and I mean "a few" character and story/location changes. When I saw this was the first writing credit for Sam Wolfson I wasn't surprised at all. You can tell. Everything that was entertaining about this film was created by a real talent over 30 years ago. It just goes to show, you don't need any real talent as a screenwriter, you just need to know someone who will get you're foot in the door.
I know it's fast fetched. Still it ain't that bad.............

review_title: Tall Girl ironically belittles its message with a towering case of marginalised insolence.
review_detailed_main:
"You think your life is hard?" narrates the eponymous skyscraper-like girl in a condescending tone as if one was participating in a selfless therapeutic course in torture. Life really must suck for her. No, seriously. I felt her solemn sadness. Being an attractive young privileged white girl with a height totalling, and this really takes the biscuit, six foot one really must take its toll. Six. Foot. Frickin'. One. Constantly getting remarks including "how's the weather up there?" and being titled "beanstalk" shatters the confidence and then some. I'm sure.

Unable to obtain high school love and succeed in life due to her colossal height. Could you imagine being six foot one? Might as well just lobotomise yourself, y'know? Just so abnormal and rare these days. Tall females apparently don't succeed in life. Supermodels? Nope. Olympians? Who? Thank God this wasn't called "Black Gay Jew", as if it was treated with the same ill-mannered direction as Tall Girl, it may have been cited as a personal attack. Look, it's a somewhat innocent approach to acquiring self-confidence amidst a wave of pessimism. But when the script hones in on stupidity like cosmetic products inspiring confidence and automatically uplifting exterior beauty, to the point where you become a different person, it's just no! That's not the message we should be sending the next generation!

More importantly though, let's address the pressing matter here. No one, absolutely no one, gets bullied because of their height. No one! So automatically, there's no relation to the central premise. Never mind the mundane acting, ostentatious directing style and unhumorous dialogue. Those are just rotten ingredients in a disastrous meal. Netflix has, yet again, released another diabolically insulting high school "comedy" revolving around popularity and bullying. With a non-sensical reasoning for abuse that cements this as the worst of the year. By far. Six foot one!? Size 13 Men's Nikes!? She's not exactly "Godzilla" with clown shoes now, come on!
Awe-inspiring movie about building self-esteem and finding yourself as an adolescent.

I liked the movie. I'm 5'11" and have had these struggles and comments my whole life so I can only imagine a girl that's gone above 6'. I'm not athletic, actually I'm a klutz, so guess my height didn't serve me in anyway to make it cool. I get not everyone can relate and that's fine but I can. Never having shoes in my size, dating guys who are insecure about me towering over them, clothes never fitting, etc. Funny part is, I married a Swede who is only 5'3" 😂 I got a good kick out of the Swede giant thingy even though his accent was terrible. It actually is kind of hurtful that so many people who I'm guessing aren't any taller than 5'8" are condemning this like it's not an issue. They've made movies and shows about being overweight, I can't relate to that personally but I enjoyed them and felt empathy for that struggle. I would never judge another's struggle or hardship so if you can't relate, move on.
A nice feel good film with a not so hard touch of the 90s rom-comedies. Perfect to autumn's night.
Simple story, Not bad acting, but the movie is kinda slow and not funny at all!!

" Tall Girl " was just another Netflix bad movie.

There were many flaws in this movie, but I'll just point out a few : -The exchange student. It was nice that he wasn't English, which was a surprise, but he wasn't Swedish either. He had a horrible accent which he remembered to display here and there. -The stereotypes, like the one about everyone in Sweden being giants. -The girl was attacked because of her hight but I just can't believe that there were no other students with the same hight. -The sister and her odd reaction to her sister's romantic problems. What's up with that? -The big twist in the end was just too sudden and it should have happened earlier in the movie. -The ending was just idiotic. I did appreciate the final point that the movie wanted to made, but the story was not good enough to support it.

review_title: A Much Better High School Romance than THE KISSING BOOTH
review_detailed_main: It's neither laugh-out-loud funny nor melodramatic. It's just a simple story about struggling to accept what we cannot change and change what we cannot accept. There are certainly better examples of such stories out there, and there are MOST certainly worse ones. I felt like the characters were written and acted in such a way as to make it easy to care about what will happen to them. All things said, I enjoyed this mostly light-hearted and straightforward romantic.

No spoilers! - Tall Girl

it just is not true lol, being tall does not make every single person in school hate you. They might tease with the "hows the weather up there" comments but i dont think that BEING TALL RUINS YOUR LIFE ? If you were born that way i think you should embrace it. The recommended height for modeling for women in the US is 5'10" and the mc is 6'0" ? What is the big deal about being tall ? I just dont understand why she thinks that being tall is the worst thing in the entire world. Also all of the 7-10/10 ratings say like "dont listen to the bad reviews" but.. if this was a good movie it would have a better overall score than 4/10..

Would not recommend and would not watch again!

Although at first blush the movie seems to be about standing up for yourself (pun intended), I think the fundamental premise of the movie is about true love: truly loving yourself for who you are, what it means to truly love family members, what true love is like between friends and romantic partners, and what true love for a potential romantic partner is not. I picked up on things the second and third time around that I missed the first time.
Quite enjoyable funny comedy and a okay story could have been better but still its a okay watch
Absolute garbage. I can't believe Netflix can go so low. Horrible concept for a movie. Everything is awful about this.
The comedy is fine but what's up with the make up artist? Why does Ava's (Jodi) make up look horrible?

The guy playing the Swedish guy isn't even Swedish. And when you're gonna make a non Swedish speak Swedish you better do your homework so the person at least pulls off the small amount of words. He did not sound Swedish, that's for sure. Also, 185 cm isn't that tall. The movie is cliche but it's for teenagers, and I'm not a teenager. But try to deliver quality for God's sake. It isn't that hard.

review_title: Nowhere near as bad as people are making out
review_detailed_main:
Found the film to be quite enjoyable and just light hearted. It's not an original movie by any stretch and has been done before time and time again, but like it's predecessors, has its own message it wants to say. It is just a good film for the kids to watch and not to bad for the parents either, so sit back, don't take the world so seriously and enjoy.

Hope this helped

Listen im all for representation i mean im a woman of color but this movie was so corny imo i see this exact same trope at least 1000 times :// also the part where she was likee u think ur life is hard im a junior w big feet or something and i was like girl there r bigger problems in the world queen.
The set decorations are so strange. Crazy wall papers. Rings of Mean Girls and Disney teen series. Pretty good family movie.

review_title: the worst film i have ever seen
review_detailed_main:
Such a waste of time
boring story
terrible actors
DON'T WATCH THIS *** MOVIE
Its a good movie the story is fresh and the ending is good but all that hate because the actor didn't talk swedish well 😏😏

So they a making out that people if your tall can't find love 6'1 ft is not that tall it's only 185 I am still 21 cm taller like what the heck

This movie must take place in the hobbit

review_title: Unrealistic. This "tall" girl is throwing a pity party.
If you were an outcast you will relate
review_detailed_main: This movie is not meant to be precise or realistic about it's characters. You might even think that the girl is not tall enough. But in reality when you are a teenager and you are slightly different from the average you will feel like an outcast. It can be anything. If someone makes fun of you for it. Or your family makes comments about. It's all what you will see wrong about yourself. The movie is about this girl struggling to see herself, despite what people have defined her as. If I still was a teenager in crisis it would have given me a little inspiration to accept myself.
This movie is seriously awful. I'm only writing this sentence because I have to write more to post this review. But the first sentence sums it all up.
Sweet little film that has bits of John Hughes classics like Pretty in Pink and Sixteen Candles. It has Ducky and a rager party and teen angst.

Tall Girl is much like Newton's third law. For every good (even great) elements the film offers, there are equally negative elements that do weight it down to its full potential. The acting was solid, but the popular click are extremely unlikable. The emotional moments and interactions are priceless, but the story and half the humor are a mess. Yeah the message (though cliche) was very well told, but some characters barely contribute. Even with a relatable character like Jody, the film is decent at best and did it's job right to entertain some people. By the way, loved Paris Berelc's performance.

review_title: A really good 2/3 of a movie
review_detailed_main: It was funny, sad but the last part was ok. Ava Michelle is a very beautiful girl. I hope she continues on the acting.

The story built reasonably well and some of the core characters developed in a satisfying way. I did find the peripheral characters very undeserved, particularly the best friend and sister. The script was fine and the acting was decent. Overall this was a conventional concept, executed by the numbers but I still found it enjoyable.

The shorts made me think that this might actually be a quirky, funny comedy. It's not. It's your typical American teen movie where the 'teens' are all played by twenty year olds. It boasts the usual cast of stereotypical 'teen' movie characters too - the smart annoying sidekick - black of course; the wise cracking pain in the neck hanger on; and Steve Zahn playing a harassed, clueless father - yet again. I didn't see the end of this, but I think we all knew how this would end while the opening credits were still running. I lasted 20 minutes or so before I gave up and looked for something better to watch. It wasn't a difficult search.

review_title: Allowing Instagram to Decide What I Watch While in Isolation Day 2:
review_detailed_main:
Did this film actually imply that cheating is okay if it's with someone who is less popular than your current girlfriend?

A decent soundtrack (for the most part) is not enough to save this from being a generic "comedy" for whiny, self impressed pre-teens.

review_title: Not as bad as everyone says
review_detailed_main: My expectations of this movie were pretty low considering everyone said it wasn't worth the watch. I decided to give it a chance and it really wasn't that bad. Classic teen movie and pretty much exactly what I'd expect from a Netflix original, at least in this category. Everyone's complaints about her complaining she's "tall" are so over dramatic it's honestly ridiculous. Yes there are more pressing issues in this world and everyone understands what those struggles are. And apparently if one movie doesn't depict every single struggle every person deals with in the world, it's a terrible shallow movie? I personally didn't think it was bad and would put it on the same level as Sarah Burgess, To All The Boys..., and The Kissing Booth. Not bad but also not great.

To be fair, the horribleness of Tall Girl is so absurd it's almost comedic. I laughed for the most part of the film. However, given that the makers' intention wasn't to make me laugh at the parts I was laughing at, I rate this movie three stars.

My favourite part was when Jodi, the main character, says something to the effect of "I stopped playing the piano because when you're good at something, people want you to do it, and I didn't want to give them a reason to stare" in her most serious, melancholic tone of voice. Oh, and when her parents thought she was a freak of nature and compared her to the tallest man in the world. And also when three people in a row greeted her with "How's the weather up there?"

P.S. Why did the Swedish guy's eye colour change from bright to dark at random? I thought they had switched actors mid-shooting!

review_title: It has potential but is not living up to it unfortunately
review_detailed_main:
There are some nice moments in this movie yet it seems poorly directed and executed.

At moments it's a B movie to me het unfortunately there are also C movie moments, and I wanted it to get better but it just didn't. For me it was an okay, wish it was better moviez.

review_title: Years go by, yet Hollywood still fails to bring a remotely accurate representation of high school.
review_detailed_main: How is this a 2019 movie? This feels like it was made in 2007. Does Hollywood actually think that tall people are social outcasts? Especially preety and rich tall people? Did the people who make this actually ever attend high school? This is one of the most out of touch movies I've seen in a while. But it mentions the words battle royal so it's cool amiright? The characters are all walking stereotypes and none of them, not even the protagonist, are likeable or even remotely good people! Not to mention the acting is average at best, the humour is painfully bad and the plot has every single high school movie cliche in the book. The levels of unoriginality are staggering. The 2/10 rating is generous. Also, sidenote, if I was Swedish I'd definitely give this a 1.

review_title: Definetely not a oscar winning material but not bad
review_detailed_main: Well nobody will remember this movie in 2 years but overall above the average teen movie. I think the sidekicks were great specially the sister and the father. I had some genuine laughter. The tall girl and the swede were not the best actors but still you kinda care about them. Perfect movie to watch while scrolling internet on your phone.

review_title: I was the tallest female in kindergarten
review_detailed_main: I'm only halfway through this movie and it's just annoying me. I'm 6'3" and have been since 10th grade. The daily torture was horrific and still is. I literally can't leave the house without someone screaming "Damn! You're so tall!" People are mostly dumb and feel like they have to remind me. The "Do you play basketball?" line is the most used of course. Met a fellow tall person that told me to respond with "Do you play mini golf?" That's awesome. Hehe
If you're complaining about watching this movie at least you don't wear men's size 13 nike's

review_title: A bit cheesy, but a cute film
review_detailed_main: Sure, the movie might be a little cheesy, but I thought it was a cute story, and I think it gets a lot of unwarranted criticism from people. I thought it was a nice movie, and I'd definitely recommend it if you're on the fence about watching it.

I tried to like this, but couldn't. Steve Zahn and Angela Kinsey and the reason for the crate were good, but everything else fell flat. None of the characters were well developed and the main character was unlikable. No chemistry between anyone, so it was pretty much anyone's guess who would end up together at the end. Definitely overplayed the whole height thing, because 6'1" isn't that tall.

The acting wasn't so bad but the storyline was seriously awful.

It shames women for giving birth by C-section, which is disgusting.

It also normalises stalking (creepy 'best friend', who continually pressures Jodi and makes her feel bad for not wanting to be with him).

It is, without doubt, the must cringe-worthy, disappointing film I have ever seen, ever.
It was definitely a cute movie. More geared towards the teenage community. But I've seen better rom coms.

So we have a tall, thin, blonde high school girl who comes from a rich family, plays piano and sings like a professional... oh, and she happens to be tall. She's only about half a foot taller than her peers (6'1"), but they're sure to cast short people as her parents to make her look even taller. They treat her like she has elephantiasis despite her just being a bit taller than average and she acts like she's a circus freak. Literally everything in her life is perfect except shes a bit tall and makes it a huge issue.

A guy shows up. Not just any guy, but a Swedish foreign exchange student who happens to be the same size as her. He's literally perfect. A genius model singer with an accent. Every girl wants him. There's a "hot" popular girl in high school who speak literally language fluently (because why not) and she's perfect too. She moves to take him and he's just kinda there, going along with it.

But NO!! He doesn't want the perfect girl, he wants the awkward model pianist who again, happens to be a bit tall.

End movie

review_title: Use Your Differences To Empower You!
review_detailed_main:
It was a great movie, filled with inspiration and EFFECT

I really loved this movie,

This movie (Tall Girl) was about a girl who struggled with her height (it made her feel self-conscious). So basically she allowed it to overtake her confidence. It also didn't helped that she got teased for it for most of her life especially in high school (typical). Then later in the movie this exchange student came rushing in, and changed the bar for her. She crushed on him, and wanted him. Then it began that she started to get in this fight with this other girl (Kimmy), 'his girlfriend'. Jodi had a lot of empowering friends (Jack) who empowered her to be her unique self and her best friend Fareeda (the feisty one) who kept pushing & pushing & pushing, who had her OWN lifestyle.

The whole story that I took from it was STAND UP to adversity, because nobody is going to do it for you. She had a really supportive friend, one who bluntly was herself. She was strong willed and kind. She was basically 'the difference' in the whole story, (Fareeda) at least I believe that to be true.

I think it was a very creative intake. When I looked at the cover of the movie, the thumbnail) from both NetFlix and YouTube I wasn't pleased, I felt I wasn't going to like it. It looked shallow to me. But my opinion was changed, when I watched the NetFlix trailer.

This movie basically teaches that it's okay to be different, that as a matter of fact it's GREAT to be different. I am very blessed to have seen this movie (Tall Girl) and that it was about a unique difference. The tallness thing meant a lot to me, as many abnormal differences would. Use your differences to empower you.

In this movie, there were a lot of the famous shows actors/actresses in it, and usually I don't care for that or just don't care. Just the people they put in, and how they 'roled' them in was just awesome. I strongly struggle watching this, especially if you feel there is something different about you and you don't like it. Because the truth people (*especially high schoolers) will usually see the worst and point out the difference in you in a very negative area. But please be strong. BE STRONG. Great movie, watch it NOW!

review_title: THE SCRIPT IS SO NOT FUNNY
review_detailed_main: The script is so forcefully trying to be funny but its not.

review_title: Find your own message in it
review_detailed_main:
I'm so used to Asian movies now that when I watch an American movie and two people who just met kiss. It seems wrong somehow. She says I'm sorry and he says I'm not. Seems so unreal.

She didn't appreciate the guy who had loved her for so long and even her friend she had dissed. Life teaches us some hard lessons sometime and we need to wake up and smell the flowers.

When we are young we make mistakes but the man who loved her made sure he was always ready to reach upward.

Lovely little fluffy, cringy and sweet love story for young adults. Find your message in it.

I'm 5" 11 and a girl. I found this film insulting. I can understand if was firirected by or the screenplay written by a tall lady who got picked on. Well I got picked on. Get over it. I'm not tall. Men are short. Most men I know are six foot or taller. I hate these stereo type films. Does she get the guy? No. He's five foot eight

review_title: Not as bad as other people think!
review_detailed_main:
A lot of these reviews are from people that were offended by one line (a comment about caesareans) in the film, or tall people who think the film is "unrealistic", etc. I am not a tall person and I wasn't offended by that scene (although I can see why a person would be, so if caesareans are a tough topic, steer clear of this), so I am going to give a review of the film from a more neutral perspective, here.

First of all, that s is a teen romcom. If you are expecting something with real depth, look elsewhere, because you won't find that here. This film is cheesy and predictable! But that's not necessarily a bad thing. The basis for the plot is a unique one, the acting and direction was good, the soundtrack excellent, and the final scene made me really, really happy, and at-the-end-of-the-dat, isn't that "ticking all the boxes"?

I agree with other reviews that perhaps this isn't"realistic", but it's not supposed to be! Again, if you want realism, look elsewhere. If you want *escapism*, something unusual, something feel-good, something cheesy, this is your film!

review_title: Her hight is normal in the Netherlands
review_detailed_main:
Over here her length is perfectly normal. I know, we are the tallest people in world (I am a woman 169cm/66,53 inches and 6cm/2,36 inches below average over here).

When I heard her hight at the begining with scene the boy who was 2 heads shorter than her(the boy who wanted to ask her out at first), I was only thinking... Why is that guy body shaming her while he is short for his gender.

That said, I don't think this is a good message for girls, because of the normal hight. Boys/girls short or tall, fat or skinny, there is a size for everyone! (As we say over here, op elk potje past een dekseltje: On every jar fits a lid)

I think if they went for an absurt hight, it would be more watchable.

I was getting in this fun, feel good teen romance... and then it was decided it was a good a idea to add in an auto-tuned song. For what was ultimately a throw away moment in an overall decent scene, it took me out of the movie enough that I needed to stop watching.

Also, joking about the ugliness of a c-section scar is a little off color considering it wasnt that funny of a line overall. Maybe would have played a bit better if the script writers had decided to play it differently (like if vapid, surface deep mother always talked about the c-section she needed to bring tall girl into the world. )

Just some very bad choices overall.

I enjoyed this movie for what it is-lighthearted and predictable. I'm mostly writing a review because one reviewer noted "absolutely no one gets bullied for their height." I can say that's not true! :) I'm 4'9, and even as an adult I get stares and all sorts of stupid comments that don't really bother me now. I was absolutely bullied in school for my height and cried more than I care to remember about how mean people could be. I totally related to the character's insecurity, just at the other end of the spectrum!
Yeah, not really that great of a movie. In the Netherlands we would call it a school with little people and one normal length girl.

review_title: A plain and simple feel good film
review_detailed_main:
The film doesn't offer much, I agree but it's better than crappy films we see these days. I really loved the artwork and the little metaphorical details added to the film which makes it even more better.

Just go for it or read a self help book. It will do.

A 6'1", wealthy class, blonde, pretty girl is just so down. The coaches at this school must have been smoking crack. They would've hounded her to be on the basketball or volley ball teams. Did she go to a school full of mini people? Those shorter guys would've been drooling over her(look up rule 34 giantess). If you really want to see a messed up high school girl, the pay attention to the chubby girl in Euphoria.

review_title: Sweet movie for young tall girls
review_detailed_main: I would've loved this movie when I was a very tall teenage girl. This is a nice confidence booster for anybody who is different. I'm exactly the same height as a main character 6'1.5" so I can relate. Where i'm from, people are generally not tall at all and I really was taller than any person at school. I was about 21 or 22 when I realized i'm not a bad looking woman and started having fun. When I moved to the US, I saw that population here is much taller and really got all the confidence I needed.

For what it is, it was fine. I liked that they covered the pleaser box with that geometric paper, but they were still stripper heels in the original box lol... the premises was weak, 6'1 isn't obscenely tall. However if you're looking to watch something to kill some time, it has a cute message and is Worth a watch

"Tall Girl" is a Comedy - Drama movie in which we watch a young girl feeling very uncomfortable due to her height. She is the tallest girl in her high school and she tries to avoid the attention of others. After some time she has to find the power to stand up and be just herself.

I did not find this movie interesting and the way it was presented such a sensitive subject was not the best. The direction which was made by Nzingha Stewart was below average and I believe that her movie is for kids between 12 and 16. The interpretations of Ava Michelle who played as Jodi Kreyman, Griffin Gluck who played as Jack Dunkleman and Luke Eisner who played as Stig Mohlin were average and none of them succeed on creating a bond between him/her and the audience. All in all, I have to say that "Tall Girl" is a boring teenage movie that does not have anything to give so, I do not recommend it to anyone.

Essentially one of those highschool message films you find on the disney change channel with slightly higher production values. This means a fair amount of cringe to sit through but its mostly fun and the majority of the youngest cast are pretty good, with Sabrina Carpenter stealing the show as the tightly wound pagaent queen big sister. Loses points for casting a non Swede who cant hold the accent as the exchange student.

review_title: Tall seriously, try being ugly or fat, or both

review_title: You want to talk about oppression?
review_detailed_main: Ok so sad rich white girl with a terrible attitude and horrible personality thinks she's oppressed because she is heinously tall. And by heinously tall, I mean she is 6 foot 1. Only 6 foot 1!!!! I am sorry but ma'am, that is not even that tall. Girl be walking around like she some kind of freak of nature but shes actually the size of a short college women's volleyball player. She's super model height. I have no sympathy for this girl whatsoever, especially considering how terribly she treats everyone around her and how she is constantly complaining about how bad her life is. Maybe the reason you cant find anyone to date isn't because you're tall, but because you literally act like infant. Like were we supposed to feel bad for you? I was genuinely confused. You want to talk about real oppression, make a movie about the people suffering in Afghanistan. Make a movie about trafficking. Make a movie about people experiencing racism. But making a movie about a relatively tall girl who cant find a date to prom because she is oppressed and goes to a school of men who are exclusively under 6 feet tall...? Yall are ridiculous lol. Don't even get me started on the ending, i actually was so embarrassed for everyone involved with the film when i saw it. Thought and prayers go out to everyone still recovering from this film.

Like others I feel like it had potential but missed the mark a bit. The overall theme about loving yourself was nice especially for teens but it was pretty formulaic in general. And as a person who went through a pretty traumatic C-section I cringed at that whole part. It's unfortunate and could have been written differently without using it. Basically not essential to the plot line and ruins the point of loving yourself no matter what cause who wants an ugly scar across your belly (face palm). Anyways I agree that with all the canceled TV shows Netflix is doing. They are making themselves out to be the Hallmark channel or all MA material. They can do better.

The STUPIDEST movie they've made yet. the movie is literally about the opression of this white girl in high school for being tall. oh yeah bc TALL WHITE GIRLS are facing the MOST opression right now lmao

I thought this was pretty perfect. I was the tall girl, 6'1" by seventh grade. The only people taller were the male teachers and they were only a couple of them. Ava Michelle did a wonderful job here. It helps that she is herself a tall girl. The kids walking by asking, "how's the weather up there?", happened a few times a week. Being called Sasquatch was a daily thing. Unless you were, the tall girl, I don't think you can actually understand. Always easy to find in a crowd, because you stood two heads over everyone. And for those saying 6'1" is not that tall, it is when you're the only one around that's that tall. Most likely those people are younger because yes, girls are taller now. But back in the 70s, nope. And if you if you didn't play sports, well... I loved how people always asked if I play/played basketball. Really! Yes it could've been better, yes the foreign-exchange student should've learned his accent better, but all in all it worked IMO! It actually plays more like a movie of the week so that's why it's probably a little cheesy in spots.

review_title: This movie inspired me to do my laundry...
review_detailed_main: The main character (tall girl) has the charisma of an ironing board. She's boring and whiney. And FYI I have a huge ugly scar across my belly after my an EMERGENCY C SECTION cause my baby girl was in distress during birth... And I would opt for a million ugly scars if it meant having her.. So up yours Netflix!!!! And like I said... After about 30 minutes of this trollop of a movie, I decided to do my laundry instead.

I have usually enjoyed Netflix's teen romances but this one bothered me the whole way through. The "nice guy" basically claims ownership of the main girl because he's always been in love with her and even though she's told him "no" repeatedly, he never gives up. He even goes so far to sabotage a potential relationship with someone she's actually interested in and I think he is the reason why that guy turned into by following his terrible advice. The scene where he goes into her room while she's sleeping is just creepy. He even says that he would wait for her forever even though she didn't want him at all. This movie tells guys everywhere that you can wear a girl down and to never take no for an answer. This guy had even an opportunity to move on with someone that actually liked him, but he wanted what he couldn't have. The dad wasn't much better because he kept basically saying there was something wrong with his daughter the way she is, though at least he realizes his errors. The main guy that the girl wanted, even though he was following the very bad advice of the other guy, it doesn't absolve him of being him either. This movie is garbage.

Look, I'm not comparing this to a super indie alternative deep film, I love cheese teen movies from the 80s, 90s, 00s and so on.. but this one had no sense at all. The cast it's not even that bad, but the writing and direction.. oh my.. you have to respect, at least, your own narrative. No surprise it's the first script from the writer. You can pass this one or just enjoy the unnecessary, but always welcome, appearences of Sabrina Carpenter and her beautiful deepp voice.
